member.name: T:Serenity.ICloneable`1
member.summary: Supports generic cloning, which creates a new instance of a generic object with the same value as an existing instance.
member.typeparam: The type of object to clone.

member.name: M:Serenity.ICloneable`1.Clone
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, returns a shallow copy of the current T.
member.returns: A shallow copy of the current T.

member.name: T:Serenity.HexEncoder
member.summary: Provides static methods to convert and translate arrays of bytes or strings to and from hexadecimal.

member.name: M:Serenity.HexEncoder.Convert(System.Char[])
member.summary: Returns an array of bytes representing the hex input.
member.param: The hex input as a char array.
member.returns: An array of bytes representing the hex input.

member.name: M:Serenity.HexEncoder.Convert(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an array of bytes representing the hex input.
member.param: The hex input as a string.
member.returns: An array of bytes representing the hex input.

member.name: M:Serenity.HexEncoder.Convert(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Returns a string containing the supplied bytes as hex.

member.name: M:Serenity.HexEncoder.Convert(System.Byte)
member.summary: Returns a string containing the supplied byte as hex.

member.name: M:Serenity.HexEncoder.Validate(System.Char)
member.summary: Determines if a specific char is a valid hexadecimal character.

member.name: M:Serenity.HexEncoder.Validate(System.Char[])
member.summary: Determines if all the chars in the supplied char array are valid hexadecimal characters.

member.name: M:Serenity.HexEncoder.Validate(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the contents of the supplied string are all valid hexadecimal characters.

member.name: T:Serenity.IO.Writer`1
member.summary: Provides an abstract base class for objects that write objects of a specific type to a stream.
member.typeparam: The type of object that will be written.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Writer class.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, cleans up unmanaged resources used by that class.
member.param: Determines if disposal is actually necessary.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.WriteCallback(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Provides a default implementation of the callback method invoked when an async write operation occurs.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.BeginWrite(System.IO.Stream,`0,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Begins an asynchronus write operation.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.Dispose
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, performs cleanup and freeing of any unmanaged resources that may have been used by the current Writer.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.EncodeLengthPrefixedData(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encodes a byte array as length-prefixed data.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.EncodeLengthPrefixedString(System.String)
member.summary: Encodes a string as length-prefixed data.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.EndWrite(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends an asynchronus write operation.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.Write(System.IO.Stream,`0)
member.summary: Writes the supplied T object to a stream.
member.param: The stream to be written to.
The object to write to the stream.
member.remarks: The supplied Stream must support writing.
member.exception: Thrown if the current Writer is already in a disposed state.
Thrown if either the stream or value paramater are null.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.WriteBytes(System.Byte[]@,`0)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes the supplied T object to an array of bytes.
member.param: When this method returns true, target will contain the byte representation of source.
The object to write to an array of bytes.
member.returns: True if the write operation suceeded, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates if the current Writer has been cleaned up (disposed).

member.name: P:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.IsReusable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which determines if the current Writer is reusable, e.g., multiple calls to the Write method can be made to the same Reader.

member.name: T:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.AsyncWriteOperation
member.summary: Represents an asynchronous write operation.

member.name: T:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.AsyncWriteState
member.summary: Provides an async state object, allowing an async writer to pass around more than one value between async methods calls.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.AsyncWriteState.#ctor
member.summary: Allows deriving classes to implement construction unheeded.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.AsyncWriteState.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,`0)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AsyncWriterState class.

member.name: P:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.AsyncWriteState.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets the stream that is being written to.

member.name: P:Serenity.IO.Writer`1.AsyncWriteState.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that is being written.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AsyncReader class.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, cleans up unmanaged resources used by that class.
member.param: Determines if disposal is actually necessary.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.Reader`1.ReadCallback(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Provides a basic callback method to support asynchronous read operations.

member.summary: Begins an asynchronous read operation.
member.exception: Thrown if the current AsyncReader is already disposed.
Thrown if either the source, callback, or state params were passed as null.
Thrown if the state param is not of type AsyncReaderState.

member.summary: Decodes a length-prefixed data block from the supplied byte array.

member.summary: Decodes a length-prefixed string from the supplied byte array.

member.summary: Ends an asynchronous read operation.

member.name: M:Serenity.IO.Reader`1.Read(System.IO.Stream,`0@)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads and returns a T from the supplied Stream.
member.param: The stream to read the T from.
When this method returns, target will contain the T object read from source.
member.returns: true if the read operation suceeded, otherwise false.
member.remarks: The supplied Stream must support reading.

member.summary: Reads a T from the supplied array of bytes, and indicates if the reading operation succeeded.
member.param: The bytes to read a T from.
When this method returns, target will contain the T read from source.
member.returns: true if the read operation suceeded, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Serenity.IO.Reader`1.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates if the current Reader has been cleaned up (disposed).

member.name: P:Serenity.IO.Reader`1.IsReusable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value which determines if the current Reader is reusable, e.g., multiple calls to the Read method can be made to the same Reader.
